page.title: 09FARMING OWERSBY GENERAL
page.content: This block is within an area of highly intensive farming,both livestock and arable.The main crops are barley,wheat oil seed rape and potatoes with some sugar beet and peas,and even an exper- imental crop of approx.12 acres of lu- pins has been tried this year.Many of the arable fields have been enlarged over the years to make way for the mas -sive machinery in use on some of the farms.A wide variety of livestock is kept;sheep,beef cattle,poultry for eggs,pigs for bacon and Anglo-Nubian goats,some of which are exported to improve the breeding stock abroad.Yet there is still room for nostalgia with one farmer breeding shire horses as a sideline and keeping them partly on old meadow still with its pattern of rig and furrow evident.Quite a contr- ast to a 50 H.P.tractor in a field of more than 200 acres.(80 hectares)
